required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Drug-drug Interaction Study in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of BMS-986020 on the Pharmacokinetics of Montelukast, Flurbiprofen, and Digoxin as Probe Substrates for CYP2C8, CYP2C9, and P-gp

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single-sequence, drug-drug interaction study in healthy male and female subjects. There is no formal research hypothesis to be statistically tested. It is expected that coadministration of BMS-986020 with montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin may increase the exposure of montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters (maximum observed plasma concentration, area under the concentration-time curve) for montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 168 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic endpoints for montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin with and without BMS-986020

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional pharmacokinetic parameters for montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 168 hour post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Additional pharmacokinetic parameters for montelukast, flurbiprofen, digoxin, and with and without BMS-986020
Collection of adverse events and other physical parameters to assess safety

arm_group.description: Treatment A: Single oral dose of montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin on Day 1 Treatment B: BMS-986020 orally twice daily (BID) on Day 8 through Day 10 Treatment C: BMS-986020 orally BID, single oral dose of montelukast, flurbiprofen, and digoxin on Day 11; BMS-986020 BID on Day 12 through Day 17

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male and female nonsmoking subjects ages 18 to 50 years, inclusive, with a body mass index of 18.0 to 32.0 kg/m2, inclusive
- Women of childbearing potential must agree to follow instructions for methods of contraception for the duration of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any significant acute or chronic medical illness
- History of arrhythmias or palpitations associated with dizziness or fainting
- History of clinically relevant cardiac disease
Other protocol defined exclusion criteria could apply

facility.name: Healthcare Discoveries, LLC d/b/a ICON Development Solutions
